intro.description:
In addition to plotting your recorded vehicle data, Debrief is able to show a number of datasets in backdrop form.
In the past we offered the VPF vectored dataset and the ETOPO-2 gridded bathymetry. But, the shiny new Natural Earth has effectively replaced both.

item.title: Getting hold of the Natural Earth dataset
item.description:
Debrief contains a very low resolution Natural Earth dataset, sufficient to provide coastlines and country boundaries.
You will probably wish to configure the higher resolution data, it will make your analysis plots much more attractive.
Your workplace may have a network copy of Natural Earth. If you have sufficient storage space on your machine (about 90Mb) you will get better performance by copying the data to your hard drive (IT policy permitting...).
But if you don't have access to a copy, you can get it from the Internet (it's about 25Mb). Just click on the Download zip button on this site: https://github.com/debrief/NaturalEarth. Once you have the zip-file, just unzip it into a safe place on your hard drive.

item.title: Tell Debrief where to find your Natural Earth data
item.description:
Next we must tell Debrief where your data is. We do this via the Preferences pane.
So, select Preferences from the Window menu. Then open up the Natural Earth preferences page from the Maritime Analysis listing. Lastly, click on Browse to navigate to your unzipped Natural Earth folder.

item.title: How to configure VPF library datasets
item.description:
Most users now find Natural Earth sufficient for background reference data. If you wish to, you can learn about the legacy VPF and ETOPO in these next steps, but I'd advice just skipping the steps and jumping forward to actual data.
The steps to configure VPF are covered in Debrief's user manual. NoPrintIf you wish to learn this at this stage, use the 'Question Mark' help link alongside, else search for VPF in Debrief's online help at some future stage.NoPrint Here's a clue though, you go into the Maritime Analysis section of the Preferences.
VPF is distributed as 4 CD-ROMS. If you don't hold the CDs you can skip this step.

item.title: How to configure ETOPO library data
item.description:
NoPrint Use the help link to the side of this text to open the guidance on how to configure the location of the ETOPO data. NoPrint Please read the relevant section of the Debrief user manual for how to specify use the Debrief/Preferences dialog the location of the ETOPO dataset.
ETOPO is distributed as a ~200Mb data-file. If you don't hold the data-file you can skip this step.
